intro: Eranthemum modestum var. majus, commonly known as the large-flowered eranthemum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
